contents: A filibuster can be an effective way to draw attention to a senator’s position or raise awareness of a bill. Supporters of filibusters note that they force compromise, instead of giving complete power to whichever party has 51 senators. (6) <u>However, opponents are concerned that filibusters, causing fewer and fewer bills to be passed,  create stagnation.</u> Some reformers want to change Senate rules to only allow “talking filibusters,” where minority (7) <u>senators would be required to speak</u> to the Senate throughout the length of the filibuster in order to prevent a vote.
